page.title: 15Industrial-history(cont'd)
page.content: During the war it was the biggest steel orks in Europe. There was a further decline in the pits after Nationalization but Ebbw Vale kept the area robust and Tredegar was still a thriving valley town. There was a further decline in collieries as those at the top end of the valley closed down or were worked out. Ty Trist. New pits. The government decided to open Llanwern Steel works on the coast and this really signalled the end of Ebbw Vale as a major steel producing works. Where 10,000 men were once employed only about 2000 remain in a modern,highly automated galvanising plant. In Tredegar it self what had been left of the T.I.C. works to cater for the pits and railways eventually closed.
